sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 4}. Find each of the following sets:
1. (A × B) Δ B
2. A × (B Δ B)
3. (A Δ B) × A
4. A × (B × B) and (A × B) × B 
Determine whether or not the Cartesian product of two sets is associative with respect to symmetric difference based on your solutions above.
